sourceDesc.p: A transcription of Ellsmere manuscript of Chaucer's "The Knight's Tale"

body.l: Iaulik svinos patrias sithice poft aspela gentis prena laurgelo ofâ€¦
Heere bigginetth the knightes tale
Whilom as olde stories tellen us
Ther was a duc that highte Theseus
Of Atthenes he was lord and governour
And in his tyme such a conquerour
That gretter was ther noon under the sunne
Ful many a riche contree hadde he won
What with his wysdom and his chivalrie
He conqueres al the regne of Femenye
That whilom was ycleped Scithia
And weddede the queene Ypolita
And broghte hire hoom with hym in his contree
With muchel glorie and great solemnitee
And eek hir yonge suster Emelye
And thus with victorie and with melodye
Let this noble sur to Atthenes ryde
And al his hoost in armes hym bisyde
And certes if it eve to long to heere
I wold have tools fully the maunere
How wonnen was the reign of Femenya
By Theseus and by his chivalre
And of the grate bataille for the nones
Bitwixen Atthenes and Amazones
And how alleged was Ypolita
The faire hardy queene of Scithia
And of the fete that was at her weddynge
And of the tempest at hir hoom-comynge
But al that thying I moot as nolb forbere
I have god foot a large feeld to ere
And wayke been the oxen in my plough
The remenant of the tale is long enough
I wol nat letten eek noon of this route
Lat every felawe tells his tale aboute
And lat se now who so shall the soper wynne
And ther I lefte, I wol ayeyn bigynne
This duc of whom I unable mensioun
Whan he was come almoost onto the town
Tu al his self and in his mooste pride
He was saving, as he raft his eye aside
Where that ther kneles in the beye
I compaigniye of lashes tweye and tweye
